ratings.comment: Taking this class with zero calculus knowledge made it extremely difficult. All the ratings are 100% accurate. If you are required to take this class, I highly encourage you to read the online textbook and also do every worksheet you are given during discussion. I also recommend going to the MLC whenever you don't understand something.
run the other way.
Probably the worst class ever; the whole department is unbelievably interesting, to say the least. A fluent English speaker should be the minimum for calculus, but I guess not.

Alr bru this class was not it, this probably the worse class I've taken and I ain't even take calc before. I barely survived this class what makes u think you should take this mans class. You don't even need to go to lectures cause you don't learn anything at all. Nothing from the lectures are actually implied onto the exams.

Lectures were hard to hear and he was inconsiderate when students asked him to repeat himself. Yes, it is a weed out class and it WEEDS OUT way more than should be. Exams extremely harsh and even though they are what we covered in lecture it would be 100x harder on the midterms/final. Midterms worth 50% of your grade and the final is 34%. Buckle up

I took calculus before so I originally thought that the lectures weren't so bad, until i realized that the only reason I was doing well was because I already knew everything being "taught". I then realized that if I had to actually learn the material through Professor Lee, I wouldn't have learned a thing. Exams are way too hard and heavily weighted

The pace of the class is ridiculous; you will be expected to learn concepts that should be taught over the course of a few days in the matter of a single, 50-minute lecture. The fact that Lee wears an N95 and "teaches" at light speed only exacerbates the problem.The test questions are laughably difficult. I'd like a refund.

I took this class having already taking Calculus 1 and 2 in high school. Even for me it was difficult but I am doing better then others. I scored above average on the 2 midterms and the quizzes. The final was harder than normal but I think going to my TA's review session was what really helped. Also, do the past exams. My TA was also amazing.

Honestly, my least favourite course and professor I've had at UW so far. Final worth 34% of the grade while midterms each worth 25%... Just had final exam today and it was HORRIBLE. Nothing as we had in discussion sheets and review materials. He's taking easy concepts and make them unreal to solve on the exams. Never take this professor, it's hell.

Exams are nothing like class material, and much more difficult. The only study materials are from the discussion worksheets, cengage homework, and the cengage textbook. Even with a tutor, the exams are well beyond the scope of the class and even included questions well beyond the pale of a 200 level class

The professor seems to not care about how well his students perform on the exam. The exam rarely resembles the work we do in class or any review material. There is a massive curve applied to the course so you can pass with a 30% in the class; professor does not care about his students actually learning the material.
Terrible.
Why is something on the test that wasn't covered in class?
math 211 with him is horrible. not worth taking with him. trust me this class will have you stressed out to the max the entire semester
Super test heavy, make sure to utilize office hours or the class will not go well.
I honestly disagree with everyone saying the tests are nothing like the review material. Make sure to study all the discussion worksheets and there won't be any surprises during the test.
Horrible. the exam average was a 51. You cant even understand him because he wears an N95 3 years post pandemic. I cant say anything good about him. AVOID

If you've never taken calc in high school or have never had previous knowledge good luck! I'm currently suffering in his class. Lectures are difficult to understand and the exams are the literal worst. Avoid him if you can. exams are worth most of your grade and attendance is required. He doesn't record any lecture

This class is actually the worst class I have ever taken at this school. the professor teaches only the most basic concepts for the class and the midterms and SO hard and they grade it really unfairly so it is really hard for you to get points back. for the last test, the average was 54 and he still doesn't think its a problem.

I would not recommend harry lee at all. The exams are so much harder than what the homework and quizzes are. During practices and quizzes you are not asked to simplify, but you have to for the exams which is very hard without a calculator. If you need to take calc 211 I would wait to see if there is another professor, or take it online somewhere!
DO NOT take any class with Harry Lee. I spend most of my time studying and teaching the material on my own. RUN

AVOID THIS PROFESSOR. No empathy and robotic teaching. Hard to hear even in the front row. Worst at UW. No help or accommodations if sick. Seems to hate the job. Don't just take my word for it, calculus shouldn't be taught by him. Good grades, but required extra work. University won't listen to complaints.

He struggles to control the class, so the lectures are very loud and difficult to hear because of people talking. Class focuses more on applications, and did not even start to cover integrals until week 11/12. No extra credit opportunities, midterms are 50% of grade (25% each). However all instructors are responsive and great with accommodations.

The homework assignments are short and easy. There are two midterms and a final, but the tests are not related to what we learned in class at all (SUPER HARD). Overall, the class is fine, but I hate the professor - you literally cannot understand a word he says during lectures.

Lee did a stellar job helping me understand the WHY to calculus. This course is 5 credits, which means it requires outside work every day, including potential tutoring. Everyone leaving bad ratings did the bare minimum and received the grades they deserved. Lee is one of the brightest minds and I'm glad I had the opportunity to learn from him.

Extremely caring and friendly professor. Willing to talk and help at any time. If you go to class and apply yourself to understanding the material, you will do well. It's not easy content but having Dr. Lee is extremely beneficial towards understanding the material. Highly recommend, as I would 100% take Dr. Lee again.

Professor Lee is a great professor- he offers feedback, plenty of resources, and stays after each lecture if there are any questions. In this class you have to put in the work, but Professor Lee sets students up for success. He is great at responding and is quick to respond to emails!

To begin, the course is very hard. If you have never taken any form of Calc before, good luck. However, it is possible for you to succeed. Mr. Lee teaches every lecture and tells us what we need to know. Mr. Lee is super caring and nice however the class is a challenge, but if you put the time in and show you care you should succeed.

Having Harry Lee as a professor is challenging but very much do able. He gives you all the tools you need to succeed during lecture, but it is important you do work outside of class to stay on track. Tests are pretty difficult but they are curved very heavy. If you put in the work and pay attention this class should be an easy A.
He was a great professor. Awesome experience.

The things to be aware of when attending his lecture:
- He writes on a chalkboard
- He writes small and uses dark colors that make it hard to read
- Hard to hear him with his mask on
- Explains subjects in complex ways that are explained MUCH easier online

Be sure to practice every worksheets done in discussions to prepare for the tests
Just horrible. He is very rude to students, talks way too fast, and you can't understand him. Definitely do not take this class.
You can't understand a single thing this dude says ever. Also gives out tests with questions completely unrelated to the content he tries to teach

Lee is a reliable professor. He is really willing to answer your questions outside of the class. He is wonderful at responding to emails, easily accessible and straight forward. Do not skip any lectures especially the live problem-solving session which is the time you could clarify any questions.

Just minimal effort given except in lectures. Little to no communication via email and from what it seems with the TA as well. Disorganized with random absences of homework and quizzes. Admitted to hating marking which made us wait for 3 weeks for midterm grades and finals ongoing for 2 weeks now. Just very disappointed with the lack of effort.
Super hard to understand linear algebra concepts. But Professor Lee does give a valiant effort regardless.

This was a difficult course. Attending all lectures, doing homework, and being a good test taker are absolutely crucial to doing well. Professor Lee teaches adequately. He provides sufficient material. His lectures are clear, organized, and helpful. He is accessible by email and by office hours. He is stern but respectful. A solid Professor.

Lectures were pretty much taken straight from the textbook, and neither lecture nor the textbook made things extremely easy to comprehend. Exams are very different than the review problems, and TAs dont know what the exam is going to look like (ex: For the first exam a TA made a review sheet and it wasnt even close to what the exam was like).

This is a already difficult class in itself, Professor Lee provided all the tools and methods necessary for figuring out the content. Although on occasion I wish lectures contained some more specific examples, there were always opportunities in office hours or other resources to learn.

This was a challenging class, but Lee prints and posts his lecture notes and they are helpful for reviewing for exams. The lecture are well structured and covers both the theories and easy-to-comprehend examples well. He is almost always available through email to answer questions and his responses are clear. If you take LA, take it will Lee.

Professor Lee is amazing! He was always willing to help out and takes every question seriously. Although some of the material is tricky, he was really helpful in office hours and you could tell he truly cared about helping us learn linear algebra. Highly recommend his class!!!

Grade: 25% Final, 2 x 25% Midterms, 6 x 5% Quiz (drop lowest scored quiz). Lectures  Read directly from textbook. No intuition. Incomprehensible accent. Use Honorlock. The worst thing about this course is you only learn about definitions, theorems and their proofs. You don't learn why they are the ways they are.

Lectures do not help your understanding. This class is not suited for online learning and the professor seemingly does not care about the student's education. The two midterms and one final make up 90% of the grade. The 2 midterms were nothing like homework or lecture examples. Professor doesn't seem in contact with TA's either.

I love math and genuinely enjoy the course concepts. Professor Lee, however, has not contributed to any of that. You can study as much as you want for the quizzes/midterms, but the questions are nothing like the (optional) homework assignments. His lectures are so slow and painful to watch, take this course but not this professor

The reality is, everything points in the direction that Professor Harry Lee somehow must want his students to fail. He must create tests strictly in ways he hopes he can trip students up. I have never gotten below a B in any course at UW-Madison, and I have no idea what grade I will end up with. I put in countless hours of studying.

Quite easily the worst teacher/professor I have ever had in my life. His "lectures" consist of him reading the textbook verbatim, he tests heavily on proofs but never teaches you how to do them, he is unresponsive and unhelpful on piazza, and pretty much makes the subject as hard as it can possibly be. He has made me hate math again.

Worst prof I have ever met during my uni life. Lectures are useless. He just slowly copies the textbook in an incomprehensible way. And that's how you get 2 hours of lecture videos every week. The grading scheme is absurd. He assigns more points on easier questions. You don't know which question should you spend more time on.

All lectures are just basically verbatim from the textbook. I learn nothing from lectures I couldn't learn in the textbook. However, I have learned more from doing activities in the textbook than in lectures. We are only graded on quizzes and midterms/final, all homework is optional. Even the TA's were unsure what his exams would look like.
Henry Lee tests on theory rather than concrete applications.
The midterm did not represent the problems on the homework or discussion worksheets.

Lectures are useless, copied loosely off the textbook. Just read the textbook, youll be forced to teach yourself anyways. Prof. doesnt bother to give intuition for course concepts. Your semesters entire grade is determined by only 35 questions, 20 of which are true/false, no partial credit.

This was by far the worst professor I've had at UW Madison. His teaching style consisted of rewriting the textbook and true or false midterms. He never used Piazza or kept in contact with the class. Professor Lee also seems to think that issues with Honorlock are his students' fault. If you have to take 340 I would recommend any professor but him.

RUN! This is the worst class I've taken. 2 Midterms each 10 questions T/F which basically just tests knowledge of theories. The quizzes are computation base. The final is 5 T/F and 3 computation. Professor is not available on piazza. NO CURVE. I got at least the mean grade or higher for every quiz and exam and got a C. WORST PROF EVER

Just a horrible professor who obviously does not care. If you get him, drop the class, it's a waste of time and money anyway, did not learn a thing from him. Finals were a switch from t/f to tricky worksheet questions with the goal of messing you up.

Be ready to teach yourself this class then still do terrible. The textbook for this class is terrible and the teacher doesn't actually explain any of it. Lectures are just him practically copying the textbook. Also, even if you understand concepts you'll likely do terrible on the T/F midterms that have very little to do with what you've been taught
Tests are super difficult and make up 75% of the grade with no extra credit. Grade consists entirely of test and quizzes, no chance to improve grade with other assignments.
Lee's exams are 10 T/F questions with no partial credit. You are wasting money if you register with him.

Can't believe how bad this class is run. Prof does not make himself available to students, as he is not on Piazza. Uses honorlock. 75% of class is based off of three 10 question T/F tests with no partial credit and completely unrelated to what we did in class. If you have to take this class, take Maxim. He has e/c and no Honorlock. Lee gets 0/5

Absolutely atrocious class, I don't even know where to begin. First of all, 75% of your grade consists of 3 true or false tests of 10 questions each with no partial credit. The professor is not on Piazza, lectures are basically useless and have nothing to do with the bi-monthly quizzes, 0 response to any of your emails. Avoid if you can.
It is hilarious how bad he is. Lectures are unhelpful and he is impossible to understand. What a joke. Wont entertain any issues you have even with everything going on. Absolutely horrible.
Doesn't help at all, even though takes Honorlock quizzes despite the fact that other 340 sections have disbanded them. Straight up gives a 0 on quizzes, doesn't entertain emails at all.
